author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Basically we need to limit how easy it is to replace blob transactions, otherwise you can ddos nodes quite quickly. For us we made the decision that blob transactions can only be replaced if both the gasFeePerGas and the BlobDataGas gets a bump (10% and 100% afaik). The current hive tests require the node to accept blob transactions that only have a gasFeePerGas bump with the BlobDataGas staying the same. But I think Mario is fixing that already

author: __flcl

author: marioevz
content:
I'm also still not entirely sure about the max fee per data gas increase, an attack could go like this in my opinion: 
- Send transaction with minimal required max fee per data gas, and max fee per gas
- Send a replace transaction with the appropriate minimum increase (10% and 100%)
- Do over and over until the source account no longer has balance for the tx to be intrinsically valid
- Wait for the block to be mined, and the fees deducted, only the block's fee per data gas will be deducted from your account
- You can repeat the attack on the next block because your account will still have a lot of the funds intact since the max fee per data gas was not deducted, only the block fee per gas.
